    • Method Detail

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves file to disk with filename hash

      • syncWithMap

        public abstract void syncWithMap()
        Sync all my instance SavablePointers and SavableLists with the runtime hash map. For any pointer, n, sync by running 'n = n.syncWithMap()` For any list, j, sync by running `j.syncWithMap()`

      • read

        public static Savable read​(java.lang.String filename)
        Parameters:
        filename - filename to read from
        Returns:
        Savable object from serialized file

      • getPointer

        static Savable.SavablePointer getPointer​(Savable s)
        Checks the hashmap for a pointer with the same hash as s. If another pointer with the same hash exists, just return that pointer. Else we create a new pointer, add it to the hash map and return it.
        Parameters:
        s - Savable object to get pointer for
        Returns:
        Pointer

      • getPointer

        static Savable.SavablePointer getPointer​(java.lang.String s)
        Parameters:
        s - Hash to get pointer for
        Returns:
        Pointer

      • getPointer

        private static Savable.SavablePointer getPointer​(Savable.SavablePointer p)
        Checks the hashmap for a pointer p. If another pointer with the same hash exists, our pointer, p, is a clone, so we will return the original pointer in the map. If no other pointer with this hash exists, we add p to the map and just return p.
        Parameters:
        p - Pointer we are checking for
        Returns:
        p if pointer with same hash as p doesn't exist, else return the pointer with the same hash

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(java.lang.Object o)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<T extends Savable>
